tab1.text1:
This is a NEW PVE server mostly vanilla focused for solo balanced and challenging gameplay but with some timesaver boosts, like taming and breeding, to encourage players to use dinos for gather resources and hunt perfect tames, so you can stay less watching huge cooldown timers and also help Ark Newbies too with the new ASA features and changes, so be nice to others but most important thing: have fun!

Auto-lock structures is always ON but keep an eye and check to have everything locked and make a bed before logging out if you don't want to lose your things.

Mods are all aimed at QoL or adding new dinos not yet released for Ark Ascended, so the risk of bugs/breaks are high specially every new updates/fixes. PLEASE BE AWARE OF THIS and be careful because if a mod may break or don't work properly after every updates.
This is ARK Survival Ascended launch, things break, gameserver can crash cause they upgrading the virtual machines hosting them, dinos and gear can possibly get lost due to bugs and crashes.

GoldCoin, Exchange and Player Shops can be updated at anytime, so check them frequently.
(You can ask/vote for suggestion on discord soon)

Daily Server Restarts: 06:00 AM UTC+1

Console commands for better performance you can enter:
r.VolumetricFog 0
r.VolumetricCloud 0

KEEP SUPER IMPORTANT ITEMS IN GAME VANILLA STORAGES - IF A MOD BREAKS AND THE MODDED STORAGE DISAPPEARS, SO DO YOUR ITEMS/DINOS (THEY WILL NOT BE REFUNDED!!)
tab1.text2:
(some settings may get fixed/changed at anytime due to balancing gameplay)

DINO MAX LEVELS:
Wild Dinos: 300
Shiny Dinos 350
Wyverns: 450
Rock Drakes: 380
TEK Dinos: 360

RATES:
XP Gain = x2
Player Harvest: x4
Dino Harvest: x7
Fast Taming/Breeding
Mating Interval: Min/Max 15/25 Minutes
Egg Hatch Speed: 1-5 Minutes
Baby Mature Speed: 2-5Minutes
Imprinting: 1 imprint for 100%
tab1.text3:
Your name cannot be Human or Humano,  Mensch or any other variation of the default names. Racist, inappropriate or highly offensive names are not allowed. Same for tribe name.
Make a tribe so the Admin knows the players who actively play and people who don't or left.
Any form of harassment, racism, homophobia etc. will not be tolerated.

No Spawn Camping/Building. Spawn points are maded for all people to be able to get Resources/arctifacts in the game, This is not Single Player Mode!

Be polite to your neighbors. Base building is a first come, first serve for locations. Always look around first before you start building a mega-base.

Pillar/foundation spamming is NOT allowed, in any way. Admins will clean up any spamming without any discussions. Do not stack foundation to build walls or fences.

You are allowed to build ONE base per tribe in a map and you can of course have a starter base and when you move to a new location please demolish the starter once you have moved.
Reserving spots is NOT allowed. When you start building, finish it.

Please try keep player, dino, tribe-names civil. We are adults so this wont be heavily enforced, but use your discretion.

Please try keep bases as reasonable as possible, again this wont be heavily enforced but its good practice to keep servers running nicely in the long term.

If you need admin help your best bet is to ask on the discord (@kylelogan0000). Please don't spawm ingame becaues when i play is because im busy testing/fixing things or mods. Thanks!

tab3.text1:
Custom Dinos currently active in the server, added by custom mods not yet released by the official game + Spawn Locations:

- Fire, Ice, Poison and Lightning Wyverns (Volcano, Snow Mountains, Swamp, Ice lakes)
- Crystal Isles Ember, Blood and Tropical Wyverns (Volcano, Forests, Rivers)
- Inferno Wyverns (1% spawn instead other Wyverns)
- Basilisks (Swamps, Redwood Forest)
- Candy Golem (Mountains)
- Deinonychus (Jungles)
- Gachas (near beaches, Jungles)
- Featherlights (Forests, Redwood Forest)
- Glowtails (Forests, Redwood Forest)
- Griffins/Snow Griffins + Prisimine* (Anywhere near Mountains)
- Ice Golems (Mountains)
- Jerboas (Beahces, Jungles)
- Maewings (Rivers)
- Magmasaurs (Redwood Forest - Not tameable yet);
- Managarmrs (Ice Lakes/Snow Mountains)
- Mantis (Swamp)
- Parrots (Dimorphodons shared spawns)
- Phoenix (when a Quetzal die she spawns - KO Tame right now)
- Ravagers (Redwood Forest)
- Reapers (Redwood Forest)
- Rejuvenating Dragons (Beaches)
- Rock Drakes (Redwood Forest)
- Rock Golems (Mountains)
- Roll Rats (forests)
- Sand Dragons (Beaches)
- Shinehorns (Beaches)
- Sinomarcrops (Forests)
- Snow Owls and R-Snow Owls + Prisimine* (Snow Biome Mountains)
- Thorny Dragons (Forests, Jungles) 
*Prisimine is a special glowing dino, can rarely spawn instead of the normal version (5% Spawn Chance)*

TEK DINOS:
Tek Giganotosaurus
Tek Mosasaurus
Tek Parasaur
Tek Quetzal
Tek Raptor
Tek Rex
Tek Stego
Tek Trike
Tek Alphas spawns too.

HOW TO TAME AND INFORMATIONS:

- WYVERNS:
Knockout them and than put the special kibble in order to feed and tame it. To get the kibbles you need to craft a Draconic Cauldron first.
Draconic Essence is used to tame ALL TYPES of normal Wyverns and ALL TYPES of Crystal Wyverns.

Friendly reminder: not all Wyverns need Draconic Essence in order to be tamed.
With the Spyglass active you can always check what food they need for be tamed!

There's a little chance a special rare Wyverns can spawn too around the map: the supreme Inferno Wyvern.
You need the Chaotic Draconic Essence to feed her after you Knocked Out it.
All Normals and Crystal Wyverns are breedable except for the Inferno Wyvern.

Baby Wyverns foods:
All normal Wyverns babies need Wyvern Milk dropped by killing Normal Wyverns.
All Crystal Wyverns need Primal Crystals dropped by killing Crystal Wyverns.
Inferno Wyvern needs Chaotic Milk, dropped by killing Inferno Wyverns.
*When you kill a Wyvern their Milks are automatically added to you inventory, you don't need to harvest them from their dead body.

- SAND DRAGON:
Becuase of its friendly nature it will not attack you. Tamed by knockout and putting the Sand Draconic Essence in its inventory which can be crafted in the Draconic Cauldron.

First Draconic creature that can dive, Breath attack that heals friendly dinos and sets hostile dinos on fire. Have a 2 hit Claw attack that sets hostile dinos on fire. Poops Sand Crystals which is a resource required for the last 2 ranks of healing potions.

tab4.text1:
Shiny Dinos are made from over 40 unique and distinct color sets, drawing from all available colors in the game, including all the new Ark:SA Dye colors, which were carefully arranged to produce beautiful Dinos which still look natural, but very different from what you are used to.
And to top it all off, there are numerous rare special abilities that Shiny Dinos can be born with, among them Frozen, Burning, Spectral, and more - and many more yet to come.

To help in your search of Shiny Dinos, you can use the included Tracker - although it may not be perfectly accurate, it'll point you in the right direction. You can craft the Shiny Dino Tracker at Level 55.

*Cryopods Mod will preserve their Shinyness, colors and their special effects*

Enraged dinos have all the dangers of an Alpha, but worse. They cannot be tamed, and they will be tough to conquer— but if you can do it, you (and your chibi) will reap the rewards. (Bigger, stronger, tougher, faster. Enraged kills drop special loot, and kills will count towards chibi XP).

Shinobi dinos are especially sneaky. Predators will have to get very close before they will even notice the Shinobi, and if you are careful, you can ride right around a threat without being spotted. They have Significantly reduced aggro range for wild dinos. That’s reduced— not none at all! Be careful.

Fathomless dinos are blue, with nothing else to give away their special strength. Perhaps one of the most useful of the Shiny set, these dinos are bigger on the inside— the weight of anything in their inventory is reduced by 80%.

Endurant dinos may sport any Shiny colour, but that’s not all. These dinos can sprint indefinitely without losing stamina. Attacks and any special abilities that would normally drain stamina will still do so.
The bodies of Burning dinos are covered in constantly burning flames. These animals are immune to damage from fire and lava, and can, if provoked, let loose with an explosion of fire that damages everything around it. AoE special attack: default Melee Key / Ctrl.

Frozen dinos are made of ice! It's ok-- the cold never bothered them anyway. Their low internal temperature allows them to keep perishables fresh as long as a regular refrigerator. They may move a bit more slowly, but they are tough. They will take reduced damage from every attack— except fire. They are especially vulnerable to flame.

Another spooky variant, Spectral dinos wander the Arks, tethered to the world of the living by some arcane energy. These ghostly dinos are transparent and insubstantial, with an eerie spirit glow. They can fall any distance without being hurt, and they walk in complete silence. Instead of pooping, they will gift you with random things channeled from the spirit plane in the form of spectral poop. (Yes, you can walk through them. You cannot walk them through walls into other people’s bases to steal their stuff!)

Don’t be too quick to judge the Filthy dinos. Their awful stench may send you reeling, but if you can tame them, and if you clean them up, they may turn out to be your best friend. (Filthy dinos spawn in with an extra level boost, but you are going to have to work for it. Submerge them fully in water to clean off the stink! Or gíve them a good scrubbing with some Soap, not everyone likes to take a bath!)

Hardy, Stalwart, Inspired, Satiate, Hefty, Fierce and Refined:
These dinos have developed a strength in one particular stat, which is more pronounced in their genes then in other dinos, which makes them quite desirable for breeding.

They have a higher chance to roll good values in their favored stat - before taming:
Hardy - Health;
Stalwart - Stamina;
Inspired - Oxygen;
Satiate - Food;
0Hefty - Weight;
Fierce - Melee;
Refined - Lower speed, higher everything else (only availabile if speed leveling is enabled, currently not);

*There is a random chance that can make Shiny Dinos have a double rolls in two stats instead of one, they will have two different names apart their Shiny type*

Shiny features over 40 color sets which all show up as names on Shiny dinos. Some abilities listed above will combine with a random color, some have their own colors.

If you encounter any name not listed here, its likely just its coloring.

tab5.text1:
The first goal is to make the original Ark Kibbles effective to get 100% perfect Tames to stay less at watching huge cooldown timers, help Ark Newbies too and to give you more time to hunt tames/breed/build!

In-Depth Guide coming soon!

Here you can see the active, how to use and how they works.

Since some mods may be udated with new changes/additions and some may breaks, this guide will be coming soon!
